clusters.name: JavaScript Event Loop & Asynchronicity
clusters.description: This cluster explores the core mechanisms of JavaScript's asynchronous execution, from the foundational event loop concept to the intricate distinctions between microtasks and macrotasks.

items.reason: As a foundational concept for JavaScript concurrency, 'Understanding the JavaScript Event Loop' serves as the entry point. It's crucial for grasping how non-blocking operations are managed before diving into more granular details.

Building directly upon the foundational knowledge of the Event Loop, 'Microtasks vs Macrotasks in JavaScript' delves into the more advanced scheduling nuances. Understanding the basic Event Loop is a prerequisite for comprehending why and how these different task queues operate.
